de.saxsys.mvvmfx.utils.itemlist

Class ItemList<ListType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.saxsys.mvvmfx.utils.itemlist.ListTransformation<ListType,String>
      • de.saxsys.mvvmfx.utils.itemlist.ItemList<ListType>
  • Type Parameters:
    ListType - type of the list elements which should be transformed to a string list
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SelectableItemList

    public class ItemList<ListType>
extends ListTransformation<ListType,String>
    Element that you can use in a View Model to transform any list to a string representation which can be bound to UI Elements like ListView. You should only expose the stringListProperty() to the view, otherwise you create a visibility of the view to the model. Create something like this in your View Model: 

     public ObservableList <String> stringListProperty(){
                return itemList.stringListProperty();
 }

    You have to provide a ModelToStringFunction to define how to map between the model type and a string and back. In addition you have properties which represents the actual selection state of a list.
    Author:
    sialcasa
